Your children said you were kind. All the kids were sitting around the dorm one night dishing the- shit out of their parents. But your kids were silent and said No, not our parents. Not Flan and Ouisa. Not the Kittredges. The Kittredges are kind. So after the muggers left, I looked up and saw these Fifth Avenue apartments. Mrs. Onassis lives there. I know the Babcocks live over there. The Auchinclosses live there. But you lived here. I came here.
But your kids - I love them. Talbot and Woody mean the world to me.
They described this apartment in detail. This is a Kandinsky! - a double. One painted on either side. May I see - ?
It's wonderful.
It's the way they said it would be.
As a matter of fact. No. Your kids and I...we both liked our parents... loved our--Look, am I getting in the way? I burst in here, hysterical. Blood. I didn't mean to---
Well, fine. It's just there. Everyone's in a constant state of luxurious despair and constant discovery and paralysis.
Although I've lived all over. My folks are divorced. He's remarried. He's doing a movie.
He's directing this one but he does act.
Cats.
You've'seen it? T.S. Eliot--
He's going to use people.
They thought of lots of ways to go. Animation.

But he found a better way. As a matter of fact, he turned it down at first. He went to tell the producers - as a courtesy - all the reasons why you couldn't make a movie of Cats and in going through all the reasons why you couldn't make a movie of Cats, he suddenly saw how you could make a movie of Cats --
Guess Who's Coming To Dinner.

He won the Oscar for Lilies of the Field and was twice named top male box-office star in the country. My father made no films from 1977 to 1987 but worked as director and author. Dad said to me once "I still don't fully understand how all that came about in the sequence it came about".

Dad's not in till tomorrow at the Sherry. I came down from Cambridge. Thought I'd stay at some fleabag for adventure. Orwell. Down and Out. I really don't know New York. I know Rome and Paris and Los Angeles a lot better.
Out to dinner?
But why go out to dinner?
You must have something in the fridge.
Why spend a hundred dollars on a bowl of rice?
- who've been wonderful to me.
I'm glad of that. Dad and I went to Russia once to a film festival and he was truly amazed how much his presence meant -
I wish.
If I wanted to write a book about him. I really can't. No one would want to read it. He's decent. I admire him.
No! We're all good friends now. . His kids from that marriage. Us - the old kids. I'd love to get in that kitchen.
My dad took me to a movie shot in South Africa.
it makes you realize that the 'crummy childhood' theory, that everything can be blamed in a Freudian fashion on the fact that you've had a bad upbringing, just doesn't hold water. May I?
My problem is I've never felt American.
That's not me. I've never felt people liked me for my connections. Movie star kid problems.
But I never knew I was black in that racist way 0 till I was sixteen and came back here. Very protected. White servants. After the divorce we moved to Switzerland. My mother, brother and Z.
Here's dinner. All ready.
Is everything okay?
My father insisted we learn to cook.
Yes. Before he made it, he ran four restaurants in Harlem. You have good buds!
The cook never eats.
Seconds?
You're like all parents. What's your major?
My father, being an actor, has no real identity.
Well...

A substitute teacher out on Long Island was dropped from his job for fighting with a student. A few weeks later, the teacher returned to the classroom, shot the student unsuccessfully, held the class hostage and then shot himself. Successfully. This fact caught my eye: last sentence. Times. A neighbor described the teacher as a nice boy. Always reading Catcher In the Rye.

Replies.Reply: I borrowed a copy from a young friend of mine because I wanted to see what she had underlined and I read this book to find out why this touching, beautiful, sensitive story published in July 1951 had turned into this manifesto of hate.
Hmmm, I said. This book is preparing people for bigger moments in their lives than I ever dreamed of.
I'll test you. I should be going.
I get into the Sherry tomorrow morning. It's not so far off. I can walk around. I don't think they'll mug me twice in one evening.
No! I have to be at the hotel at seven AM sharp!
or Dad will have a fit.
If it's any problem--
Six fifteen? I'll tip toe out.
It's done.
He's not. Dad said I could be in charge of the extras. You'd just be extras. That's all I can promise.
No. You can be humans.
Did I intrude?
I'm sorry - Oh Christ -
Nobody comes in on Sunday.
You'll have every bug in Christendom -
No. You watch. It gives me a thrill to be looked at.
Two million dollars?
Go to ten? Ten million?
Nothing?
Your kids said you were an art dealer. But you don't have a gallery. I don't understand -
I couldn't tell -
I'm glad I helped -
I'm so pleased I was wonderful.
It's going to be time for me to get up.
Oh Christ. Regretfully. I4l1 tip toe.
Don't need it.
But I'll get it back to you tomorrow. I want my father to meet you.
Could I?
I can explain.
Please. Don't tell my father. I don't want him to know. I haven't told him. I got. so lonely.
I can explain!
I spent it.
I'm so sorry.

The imagination. That's our out. Our imagination teaches us our limits and then how to grow beyond those limits. The imagination says listen to me. I at your darkest voice. .I am your 4am voice. I am the voice that wakes you up and says this is what I'm afraid of. Do not listen to me at your peril. The imagination is the noon voice that sees clearly and says yes this is what I want for my life.
I don't know how to thank you, sir. My father is coming here.

Doug's told me all about your brownstone. How you got it at a great price because there had been a murder in it and for a while people thought it had a curse but you were a scientific man and were courageous!
Pardon?
Breaking and entering?
Officer, your honor, your eminence, Dr. Fine cave me the keys to his brownstone. Isn't that so?
This man gave me the keys to the house.
What's this?
All these names. Addresses.
Tell me about these people, man!
Are these all rich people?
I think it must be very hard to be with rich people. You have to have money. You have to give them presents.
That's what pots of jam are for?
I'll tell you what I'll do. I pick a name. You tell me about them. Where they live. Secrets.
Kittredge. Talbot and Woodrow.
A Kan--what- ski?
That's enough for today.
Bodd-ill a bee-ya.
Bodd-ill a bee-ya.
Bodd-ill a bee-ya.
Bodd-ill a bee-ya.
Bottle of beer.
I was hallucinating from not eating-
Do they have any black people in Utah?
My gosh!
Like the painters. Cezanne looked for the rules behind the spontaneity of Impressionism.
My dad loves painting. He has a Kandinsky but he loves Cezanne the most. He lives up there.
He lives up there. Count six windows over.
They go to Andover and Exeter and Harvard and Yale. The awful thing is my father started out good. My mother says there is a good man inside s J. Flanders Kittredge.
I call him. He hangs up.
He doesn't have an office. He works out of there. They won't even let me in the elevator.
I don't want to embarrass him. Look, this is so fucking tacky.
Live? I'm,home.
You're such assholes. Where would I live?
This is the way you must speak.
Bottle of beer. And never be afraid of rich people. You know what they love? A fancy pot of jam. That's all. Get yourself a patron.

He wrote me! I wrote him and he _ wrote me back! He's going to give me a thousand dollars! And that's just for starters! He sold a Cezanne to the Japanese and made millions and he can give me money without her knowing it.
I'm moving out of here!

But I am going to give you the money to put on a showcase of any play you want and you'll be in it and agents will come see you and you'll be seen and you'll be started. And when you win your Oscars - both of you - you'll look in the camera and thank me -
One hitch. I'm going to meet him in Maine. He's up there visiting his parents in Dark Harbor.
I'll be gone a week. But I could wire it back to you.
Look. No problem. I understand.
He does. It'll work out. Hey.
Stick with me, baby. I know the right name to drop.

She'll have it back. With interest. Wonderful bouquet. Bouquet. That's what you call the taste of the wine. And I believe that wine from the even numbered years is generally the superior to the odd numbered years. Although it's just a theory - Cheers! Skol! Prosit!
Do you want to dance?
Every moment in life is a learning experience or what good is it? Right? Right?
Then let this bunch of jerks see class.
Amigo! When will you learn! Money is one commodity you can always get.
I was wondering if I could fuck you.
That's what makes it so nice. You don't.
Hello?
I saw the story in the paper. I didn't know the boy killed himself. He gave me the money. I didn't steal any -
If you put me on hold, I'll be gone and you'll never hear from me again.
Would you help me?
Stay with you.
Why?
Do you?
I do not have it. It's a miracle. But I don't.
Travelling.
No, I only visited you. I didn't like the first people so much. They went out and just left me alone. I didn't like the doctor. He was too eager to please. And he left me alone. But you.
Everlasting friendship.
You do.
You're going to tell me secrets? You're not what you appear to be? You have no secrets.
I don't tell that. I save that for blackmail.
No! I went to a museum! I liked Toulouse-Lautrec!
I read the Andy Warhol Diaries.
Are you laughing at me?
I read The Agony and the Ecstasy by Irving Stone about Michelangelo painting the Sistine Chapel.
Have you seen the Sistine Chapel?
You've been to the top of the Sistine Chapel?
You slapped God's hand!
No!
Take me to see it?
Who's there?
I come there and you'll have the cops waiting.
Why?
Who's there?
Are you in tonight? I could come and make a feast for you.
Where are you going?
Hi! Can I come to Sotheby's?
I said hi to Flan.
That's wonderful! I'll come!
Why? I was helpful last time -
Really! I was thinking maybe that's what I should do is what you do - in art but making money out of art and meeting people and not working in an office -
I could learn the grotty -
I'm here.
If you let me stay with you, I'll tell you.
You let me use all the parts of myself that night -
Graduation speech at Groton two years ago.
Other people's recipes. Did you see Donald Harthleme's obituary? He said Collage was the art form of the 20th century.
Not your children. Not your life.
You don't sound happy.
Never say I'm stupid -
What could I be?
With you behind me?
No.
I was so happy. I wanted to add sex to it.
I'll tell you my name.
It's Paul Poitier-Kittredge.
Start what?
Will you help me?
Will you send me books and polaroids of you and cassettes? And letters?
Will you visit me?
And when you do, you'll wear your best clothes and knock em dead?
I won't have sex in prison. I only have sex when I'm happy.
Will you take me?
I'll be treated with care if you take me to the police. If they don't know you're special, they kill you.
Mrs. Louisa Kittredge, I am black.
And I'll plead guilty and go to prison and serve a few months.
Then I'll come out and work for you and learn -
I want to know now.
Learn all the trade. Not just the grotty part.
And live with you.
Your kids are away.
You'll help me find a place?
I have no furniture.
I made a list of things I liked in the museum.
I'd rather have one nice piece than a room full of junk.
All I have to do is go to the police.
Tonight.
Bring me?
I have black tie from a time I went to the Rainbow Room. Have you ever been to the Rainbow Room?
What time do you have to be there?
It's five thirty now. You could come get me now and take me to the police tonight and then go to Sotheby's--
Japanese?
You're just like my father.
Sidney!
I'm in the lobby of the Waverly movie theater on Sixth Avenue and Third Street.
I'll give you fifteen minutes grace time.
Ouisa., I love you. Ouisa Kittredge. Hey?
The Kandinsky is painted on both sides.
Bottle of beer.
Very good. You owe me.
FLAN is driving terrifically fast. OUISA puts on a tape.
You look horrible!
Did you say you could have been killed?
What?
Bride's side? Groom's side.
Is anything wrong?
We hate to pry -
I didn't know Geoffrey was in town.
Didn't he invite us to visit him?
And then?
THE PEOPLE in the pew in front gasp.
THE WEDDING GUESTS file into the cheery club, all bright white and a shade of cheery green that only country clubs seem to find.
But what happened -
We're worried for you FLAN and OUISA look at each other.
Sandy forgets he was married to Susie Baxter.
He's an art dealer.
I know who he is now.
Not on your life.
Oh yes through...
Lovely man.
That's no reason why she can't invite me to a party.
FLAN puts down his drink.
we weren't sucking up. We like Geoffrey.
What did you want from us?
Listen.
It always amazes me when New York is so quiet.
One has to stay there to educate the black workers and we'll know we've been successful when they kill us.
You don't think of it like that.
Oy vay China. As my grandmother would say.
Wonderful view.
Where should we?
God! The restaurants! New York has become the Florence of the Sixteenth Century. Genius on every corner.
The new Italian looked cheery.
You have to come to South Africa so I can pay you back. I'll take you on my plane into the Okavango Swamps -
Elephants?
It's been wonderful seeing you--
My time is so short. Before I leave America, I really should call -
Lovely book.
Agreed.
My god!
Did you bitch your parents?
Don't mock.
Your father means a great deal in South Africa.
You wish?
I vote - stay in.
Johannesburg.
What about being black in America?
This is the best pasta I've ever -
The islands.
See? Good buds. I've never been complimented on my buds-
To Cats!
The one that was stolen. Please?
I'm going to buy a copy of Catcher i. the Rye at the airport and read it.
I'll fly back. With my wife.
We haven't got any business done tonight.
Flanders. Look, I've been thinking.
I'll call Poitier at the Sherry --
They're calling my plane- And again last night-
The banks.
Exactly.
THE HALL.
THE CHUMS listen enrapt. OUISA is serious.
THE CHUMS are transfixed.
OUISA is moved by these events.
FLAN turns to JULIA.
Three. Two at Harvard. Another girl at Groton.
Can it be possible? A FEW MORE GUESTS have joined the table.
Can it be? The CROWD listening to FLAN and OUISA is even larger.
THE CHUMS hang on OUISA's every word.
THE CROWD is astonished.
The imagination has moved out of the realm of being our link, our most personal link, with our inner lives and the world outside that world--
Up at six fifteen which is any moment now and we have that wedding in Millbrook-
In cat suits?
FLAN happily sits in the bright vast empty space at a slide carousel projecting slides of paintings into the air.
The bright pink morning sky flashes with golden blotches, abstract, until WE see it is the morning sun reflecting off windows on the West Side of Central Park.
What the fuck is going on here. Who the fuck are you?!
Hey! How ya doin'? Nice stuff.
Hey. I got to get some sleep--
Yeah. I might have a gun. I might have a knife.
Fuck. You!
Is everything all right?
GEOFFREY puts the phone down on the security belt.
Below us FLAN and,OUISA's car heads for the garage.
Do we have a story to tell you!
we win. Our story happened Friday night.
We are going to be in the movie of Cats.
I am not impressed but it was the son of -
The kid was mugged. We had to go out. We left him. He was so charming. His father was taking the red eye. He couldn't get into the Hotel till seven AN. He stayed with us.
Twenty-five dollars until his father arrived.
Can't get through.
Greta Garbo used the name Harriet Brown.
Try Who's Who.
I think we should go to the police.
We gave him twenty five.
He chased the burglar out of our house.
Top to bottom. Nothing gone.
I have a friend who does theatrical law.
Nobody!
Nobody. Nobody. Nobody.
Oh dear.
Our kids. Struggling through their lives.
Are you afraid Ben is mixed up in this fraud?
You think Ben is hiding things from us? I tell you, I'm getting to the bottom of this. My son has no involvements with any black frauds.
Yes.
Listen to the last page. ".. .making it better for our children. Protecting them. From what?
Now can you outgrow them?
Who are you buying it for? The Japanese?
When did your story happen?
We're going to be in the movies.
Friday night we were home, the doorbell rang---

In the middle of the night, we heard somebody screaming Burglar! Burglar! We came out in the hall. Paul is chasing this naked blonde thief down the corridor. The blonde thief runs out, the alarm goes off. The kid saved our lives.
We feel so guilty. Paul could've been killed by that intruder. He was very understanding -
Nothing.
She gave the name.
He must be there under another name.
Everybody must have known she was Greta Garbo.
Try the public library.
A pot of jam.
We looked and looked.
Who knows Sidney Poitier so we could just call him up and ask him?
What friend?
I want to know.
Whatever's going on anywhere, I do not want to know. I don't want to know.
I don't want to know anything about the spillover of their lives.
I think we should drop it right here.
I don't want to know too much about my kid.
I don't want to know.
No.
I don't want to know.
I don't want to know. I don't want to know.
The nudes? The bathers? The dancers?
Then it's the Germans.
Out of which you will keep -
THE DETECTIVE makes notes.
What are the charges?
Sidney Poitier?
Was he?
Look. We're very busy.
Come up with charges. Then I'll do something.
I got a call that might interest you.
When this young lady told me the black kid was your son, it all seemed to come into place.
Find out where he is.
Well, Mom, you should have let him stay. You should have divorced all your children and just let this dreamboat stay. Plus he sent you flowers.
You put him in that bed. I'm not going to get involved with any conspiracy.
That's like about fifteen people.
That's why I'm going to Afghanistan.
Is that all I am? An investment?
You went to Cats. You said it was an all time low in a lifetime of theater going.
You said Aeschylus did not invent theater to have it end up a bunch of chorus kids wondering which of them will go to Kitty Kat Heaven.
Well, maybe he'll make a movie of Starlight Express and you can all be on roller skates!
This is so racist.
This is the KGB.
This is the entire McCarthy period.
You've never done anything but tried to block me.
You want me to be everything you weren't.
Trent Conway. -
Trent Conway.
So I went to MIT. He was there in his computer room and I just pressed him and pressed him and pressed him.
His past? His real name?
He took stuff from you?
Will you press charges?
It's a felony.
What do you have on?
Mother, that is such a beautiful thing. Do you realize the agony cosmetic companies put rabbits through to test eye shadow?
Mother, I'm getting married.
I am going to get married and then go to Afghanistan.
Immediately so deeply negative--
The arrogance that you would assume you know everyone I know. The way you say it: I know everyone you know -
No one ever calls on that number.
Mother!
Mother! I -
Dad! We were cut off. I'm getting marr -
I'm getting married and going to Afghanistan -
I'm going to ruin my life and get married and throw away everything you want me to be because it's the only way to hurt you!
Dad. Mom. Please. For once. Please?
He promised you parts in Cats?
This is so pathetic.
I'm only this pathetic extension of your eighth rate personality.
Trent Conway.
The Alaskan Husky barks at the moon.

Characters.Character: EXT BETH ISRAEL DOCTORS HOSPITAL DAY

Replies.Reply: FLAN and OUISA, KITTY and LARKIN come to this hospital across from Gracie Mansion.
There's a friend of your son's here.
The son of who? Dad, I never heard of him.
You're an idiot! You're an idiot!
A cretin! A creep! No wonder mother left you!
Dad? Spare me?
Why do you look at me when you say that? Do you think I'm an addict? A drug pusher? I really resent the accusations.
This is so humiliating.
How can I get in touch with anybody in high school? I've outgrown them.
Never!
You never do anything for me.
Social Darwinism pushed beyond all limits.
You said drugs and looked at me.
Look at those beady eyes staring out at me.
Did you give him the key to the house?
A COPY OF SIDNEY POITIER'S AUTOBIOGRAPHY: "This Life"
TRENT CONWAY'S YEARBOOK PICTURE TRENT is weasel faced. Very hard to read. Not quite looking into the yearbook photographer's camera.
RICK lost in the nighttime park.
FLAN and OUISA, KITTY and LARKIN, and DR. FINE cut through the Harvard Yard at an urgent pace.
The FIVE PARENTS sit in the empty Dining Commons.
And BEN is just as loud.
That's your problem in a nut shell.
I just want to get one thing straight.

You gave him my pink shirt? You gave a complete stranger my pink shirt? That pink shirt was a Christmas present from you. I treasured that shirt. I loved that shirt. My collar size has grown a full size from weight lifting. And you saw my arms had grown, you saw my neck had grown. And you bought me that shirt for my new body. I loved that shirt. The first shirt for my new body. And you gave that shirt away. I can't believe it. I hate this life. I hate you.
You gave away my pink shirt?
He's at MIT.
WOODY's wrath grows and grows and drives OUISA and FLAN, indeed all the PARENTS, out of the serene, venerable Harvard building onto the street. PASSERSBY stop and gape.
But what happened between you?
It was...It was...
My address book.
This is where I wanted you to be...
I just want to look at you. Sorry.
No. Hand to mouth on a higher plateau.
Not at all. Rich people do something nice for you, you give them a pot of jam.
Orange. Grapefruit. Strawberry. But fancy.
All right.
Talbot called Tess was anorexic and was in a hospital for a while.
Ouisa and Flan for Flanders Kittredge. Rhode Island I believe. Newport but not along the ocean. The street behind the ocean. He's an art dealer. They have a Kandinsky.
Kandinsky. A double-sided Kandinsky.
I feel like Scheherazade!

I don't want you to leave me, Paul. I'll go through my address book and tell you about family after family. You 111 never not fit in again. we'll give you a new ideas it.y. I'll make you the most eagerly sought after young man in the East. And then I'I1 come into one of these homes one day---and you'll be there and I'll be presented to you. And I'll pretend to meet you for the first time and our friendship will be witnessed by my friends, our parents' friends. If it all happens under their noses, they can't judge me. They can't disparage you.
This is the way you must speak. Hear my accent.
Bottle of beer.

We went through the address book letter by letter. Paul vanished by the L's. He took the address book with him. Well, he's already been in all your houses. Maybe I will meet him again. I sure would like to.
I don't know anything about him.
Besides the address book? He took my stereo and sport jacket and my word processor and my laser printer. And my skis. And my TV.
No.
Why do they want to find him?
Look, we must keep in touch. We were friends for a brief bit in school. I mean we were really good friends.
They say to help him. If there's a crime, the cops will get involved.
Three months?

THE DRIVER stands up seeing PAUL run out. RICK runs out of the CARRIAGE after PAUL. THE DRIVER chases them.
THE VATICAN.
with FLAN and OUISA. They are escorted, through a maze of scaffolding, by an elderly Italian ART DEALER.

THE CROWD gasps.

OUISA leans forward at the dinner table.
Your son! I know all about your son.
Not the little shit who lives here. The other son. The secret son. The negro son you deny.
The black son you make live in Central Park while you're gallivanting around Rome.
THE DETECTIVE sits on the edge of his desk.
and we met this guy and started singing and talking.
If I told people back home that New York had trees and picnics, they'd swear I was lying. I love New York so much. Look at it! I can't get over it.
I saw them once. Two black people.
We came here to be actors.
"The quality of mercy is not strained.
Because you have to have technique.
We don't know anything about painting.
He'll see you if he is that good. He can't forget you entirely.
Say you have a masterpiece for him.
A lot.
You're not out on the streets?
We just have a railroad flat in a tenement --
A railroad loft and we could give you a corner.
He stayed for a few weeks. He taught us so much. We even thought he was the reason for coming to New York. He opened up a new world for us. That's all anybody wants, isn't it? A new world?
Hello.
Hello hello!
Masha in Three Sisters.
No, Irina first. The young one who yearns for love.
Then Masha who loves.
Then the oldest one, Olga, who never knows love!
Do you think it'll hurt me?
My resemblance to Liv Ullmann.
I knew it!
You can't!
I want to thank Paul Kittredge.
How long would you need it for?
We can't. If something happens -

Paul. I'm sorry. We just can't.

- people named Kittredge. This Kittredge guy has a black son he makes live in the park -
His black son took money from me -
I want to get up to see them!
They owe me money!
I'm here trying to get to meet people.
"The quality of mercy is not strained?"
Where's the money?
He rambled on for hours. His own father warned me Rick was a fool and I looked at Rick and knew his father was right.
Don't touch me!

Nobody did this but you.
I want Paul dead. He took all our money. He took my life. Rick's dead! You bet your life I'll press charges.

Maybe two.

No! Let me explain. Paul found some extra money of his own and he wanted to thank us for staying here! He would've treated you but you had to work or else we would've . We rented these tuxedos! Isn't it a gas! He's going to give us the money back! And then I'm going to take you to the Rainbow Room. That's where we went! I brought you matches!

You are just about the greatest -
